2025-01-01.history: Octave of Christmas honoring Mary’s divine motherhood.

2025-01-02.saint: Sts. Basil the Great & Gregory Nazianzen
2025-01-02.history: Cappadocian Fathers and Doctors of the Church.

2025-01-03.saint: The Most Holy Name of Jesus
2025-01-03.history: Honors the saving name of Jesus.

2025-01-04.history: First American-born saint; founder of the Sisters of Charity.

2025-01-05.history: The manifestation of Christ to the nations through the Magi.

2025-01-06.history: Humble Canadian religious famed for devotion to St. Joseph.

2025-01-12.history: Closes the Christmas Season; Jesus revealed as the beloved Son.

2025-01-13.history: Bishop and Doctor; defender of the Trinity.

2025-01-14.history: Ordinary Time begins after the Baptism of the Lord.

2025-01-15.history: Ordinary discipleship lived in daily life.

2025-01-16.history: Growth in grace through daily fidelity.

2025-01-17.history: Father of monks; model of conversion and spiritual warfare.

2025-01-19.history: The call of the disciples and the Lamb of God.

2025-01-21.history: Young Roman martyr; exemplar of purity and courage.

2025-01-22.saint: St. Vincent, Deacon & Martyr; St. Marianne Cope (USA)
2025-01-22.history: Vincent of Saragossa martyred; Marianne served lepers in Hawaii.

2025-01-24.history: Bishop, Doctor; gentle guide to devotion for all states of life.

2025-01-25.history: Saul encounters Christ and becomes Apostle to the Gentiles.

2025-01-26.saint: 3rd Sunday in Ordinary Time (Sunday of the Word of God)
2025-01-26.history: Focus on Scripture as living word for the Church.

2025-01-27.history: Founder of the Ursulines; educator of girls.

2025-01-28.history: Angelic Doctor; master of theology and Eucharistic devotion.

2025-01-31.history: Founder of the Salesians; father and teacher of youth.

2025-02-01.history: Abbess and patroness of Ireland, model of hospitality.

2025-02-02.history: Christ, light to the nations, is presented in the Temple.

2025-02-03.saint: St. Blaise, Bishop & Martyr; St. Ansgar
2025-02-03.history: Blaise associated with blessing of throats; Ansgar missionary to Scandinavia.

2025-02-05.history: Sicilian martyr, patroness of purity and courage.

2025-02-06.history: 26 martyrs of Nagasaki bear witness to Christ.

2025-02-08.saint: St. Jerome Emiliani; St. Josephine Bakhita
2025-02-08.history: Jerome served orphans; Bakhita, former slave turned saint of mercy.

2025-02-09.history: Christ calls us to be salt and light.

2025-02-10.history: Sister of St. Benedict; exemplar of prayerful love.

2025-02-11.history: Apparitions to St. Bernadette; day of the sick.

2025-02-14.history: Apostles to the Slavs; patrons of Europe.

2025-02-16.history: Jesus fulfills the Law with perfect love.

2025-02-17.saint: Seven Holy Founders of the Servite Order
2025-02-17.history: Florentine merchants who formed a community dedicated to Our Lady.

2025-02-18.history: Everyday holiness in work and family.

2025-02-20.history: Listening to God in the ordinary.

2025-02-22.saint: Chair of St. Peter the Apostle
2025-02-22.history: Celebrates Peter’s pastoral authority and Church unity.

2025-02-23.history: Christ commands love of enemies and perfect mercy.
